document_data.caption: A swarm of swamp striders rush forward across brackish marsh water.
document_data.name: Swamp Strider
document_data.mainbody: '''Swamp striders''' were a species of swarming, predatory insects that could walk across bodies of water thanks to their physiology.
document_data.Description: These insects were about the size of mundane [[beetle]]s, measuring {{SI|7|in|long=yes}} in length and weighing {{SI|0.5|lb|k|long=yes}}. They had dangerously long, spiked suckers.
document_data.Abilities:
Swamp striders could see in areas of [[Darkvision|total darkness]], as well as sense creatures within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} of them walking in the same body of water. 

These insects were capable of walking across water as if effected by ''[[water walk]]'' and would even float to the surface if submerged.
document_data.Combat: When in a swarm, swamp striders would surround and attack living warm-blooded prey larger than them. They pierced them with their suckers to cause bleeding.

Sub-Species.Underdark strider: Swamp striders that inhabited the lakes and seas of the [[Underdark]], such as the [[Lightless Sea]], differed from their surface brethren in that they had a white coloration and were [[Blindsight|blind]].

Ecology.Habitats: Swamp striders were found within warm marshes of the Realms. They were particularly known to inhabit the [[Adder Swamp]] of [[Chessenta]] and the [[Vast Swamp]] of [[Cormyr]], often terrorizing the inhabitants of the latter.
Ecology.Usages: Some [[humanoid]] races hunted swamp strider swarms on occasion, considering them to be a fine delicacy when roasted.

document_data.History: Around [[1372 DR]], swamp striders were counted among the many creatures that one could only rarely encounter while traversing the [[sewers of Waterdeep]].
